meanings.definition: Jukus (noun): a type of Japanese educational institution
meanings.sent1: In Japan, students attend a jukus after school for extra learning.
meanings.sent2: The jukus helped the students prepare for their exams.
meanings.sent3: The jukus was so popular that it had a waiting list.
meanings.sent4: Her mind became a jukus of knowledge after studying there.
meanings.sent5: The jukus buzzed with the sound of eager learners.

meanings.definition: Jukus (verb): to attend or participate in a jukus
meanings.sent1: She decided to jukus to improve her grades.
meanings.sent2: Students often jukus during exam season.
meanings.sent3: He would jukus every weekend to stay ahead in class.
meanings.sent4: Their dedication to jukusing paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: Jukusing regularly helped them succeed academically.

meanings.definition: Jukus (adjective): relating to or characteristic of a jukus
meanings.sent1: The jukus teacher was known for her strict but effective methods.
meanings.sent2: The students appreciated the jukus atmosphere for learning.
meanings.sent3: His jukus style of teaching made the lessons engaging.
meanings.sent4: The jukus environment fostered a sense of academic growth.
meanings.sent5: The jukus culture valued hard work and dedication.
